page.title: 13Loughor's American Link.
page.content: Facilities for leisure in the Loughor area are provided in the main by Penyrheol Leisure Centre,and by the Swansea Recreation Centre.However there is a local park with a well tended attractive flower garden,open fields,two soccer pitches,tennis courts,paddling pool for toddlers,a playground and a bandstand.The whole area is surrounded by trees and is an attractive foil to the castle remains,the church and Loughor bridge. This park was provided for Loughor by the descendants of John Williams,once a native of Loughor who in the hard times of the industrial slump went to America to make his fortune.He founded the huge Weirton steelworks,many of whose employees are related to the first Welsh exiles.He also founded a scholarship for Loughor scholars to study in America annually.
